caption: Small museum but interesting. If you are around you can lose 30 min here with cool informations
Please mark that that it is closed on Google Maps. We came during the normal times but the museum is closed in august.
Very beautiful museum, modern, with adapted mediation. Very interesting subject of temporary exhibitions. I recommend!

Very nice exhibition on perfumes at the moment and at the same time the museum is really interesting and complements what we already know. Being interested in social issues, I was able to learn new things and I also liked the connection with the admirable Familistère de Guise which I also visited. We were well received, the museum is pleasant to visit, especially since we were alone for the visit and we were able to take our time and see everything peacefully.

Small museum presenting on the ground floor the local history from viticulture to industry, the first floor is more devoted to town planning and to Henri Sellier who was mayor of the city between 1919 and 1941 and minister of public health in the government on the popular front, he was one of the promoters of garden cities. The exhibitions are generally related to town planning and quite informative. The museum is located in the old Suresnes Longchamp station and the T2 tram stops at upstairs level but you still have to go down a flight of stairs. The reception also serves as a shop and an elevator connects the ground floor and the 1st floor. Temporary exhibitions regularly. The museum is free on the first Sunday of the month.

If you love the garden city then the permanent collection is a real treat. We see the city being built little by little. The postcards showing the different streets take us back in time. Lots of short films that bear witness to the past of schools and systems for children. Temporary exhibitions are also available.

Super interesting museum with architecture perfectly integrated into the old railway station  The permanent collection presents Suresnes from its creation until the 1950s The upstairs room very precisely traces the history of the garden city, the hygienist improvements of the time and its famous mayor Henry Sellier, instigator of all these projects.  June 2022 temporary exhibition on the Seine as a development asset for the territory of the Ile de France, greater Paris and its region  Free locker available The lady at reception is very welcoming and warm.

I accompanied my son's class on an outing to the MUS... Fun workshop on the theme "design". Friendly staff, the children really liked it and got into the game... Target object: a chair or rather a “seat”. Friendly approach, the children participated.. Return to the past with the outdoor school at Mont Valérien.. The globe was recently renovated... Atypical school classified as a historic monument... Visit to do.. Go there and you you will also see all the brands and factories of yesteryear established in Suresnes...

We were sitting on the terrace of the café opposite the museum with a friend, an employee was waiting near the museum when her superior arrived and verbally attacked her by telling her "why did you come early" in an aggressive tone of voice "I won't pay you for overtime, there's no point in you asking me for it" this short, stocky woman with bobbed hair should be ashamed of publicly humiliating her employee. This type of behavior is to be prohibited and has been denounced. I think this is not the only harassment this young woman suffers.
The museum is indicated as OPEN this August 9, 2024. And closing at 6 p.m. We go there and a sign says “Closed August 5-20.”

I was lucky enough to have an outstanding guide to visit this museum. I appreciated his passion and the way he conveyed it. There is a way to better understand the city and the "drawers" under certain pieces of furniture give access to really interesting elements (which could not have been exposed without this tip of installing them in the drawers). It's a small museum on a human scale and a great invitation to learn in an interactive way.
A beautiful museum to discover the history of the town of Suresnes!

Very good, the themes are interesting, a nice tribute to Henri Sellier, a man who did so much for the living and housing conditions of a population in great need. The exhibition on hygiene and the city “it’s clean” is really well done, I saw everything, thank you very much. I will be interested in the upcoming exhibitions in this museum.

Nice municipal museum located in the old Suresnes station. We saw an interesting temporary exhibition there on the Seine. The permanent exhibitions are also enriching: local life and the garden cities created and developed by Henri Sellier in Suresnes and all around Paris. I recommend
Very interesting current exhibition "Suresnes City of Perfumers"

Always very fun workshops to do with the children. With the added bonus of an Introduction by visiting part of the museum, according to the theme of the workshop. People who are always welcoming, smiling and caring.

Very quiet and small museum that has a permanent exhibition about Suresnes. Not interesting in itself, but they had a temporary exhibition about Grand Paris and its history. From the end of the 18th century to the present, the administrative reorganizations were discussed and how Paris has grown over the years.
